title: Ticket #3048: Condor fails to write abort event after system_periodic_remove
description:
We're seeing a large LHC Condor site having issues with events missing from the user log. Because Globus solely uses the user log to get notification of user events, it's causing large inconsistencies between Globus and Condor. Because the pilot factories stop submitting when there are a sufficient number of idle jobs in queue (and the user log only contains the submit event), this causes the pilot factory to stop submitting and the site to idle.

This is high-priority for OSG, as it is stopping production at the site.

Jaime knows most of the details. I did some detective work and found the following. 

06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) WriteUserLog Failed to convert event type # 9 to classAd.
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) WriteUserLog: user doWriteEvent()!
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) Unable to log ULOG_JOB_ABORTED event for job 1727620.0
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) Failed to write abort event to the user log
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) Job 1727620.0 aborted: The system macro SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE expression '(User =!= "XXXX@YYYY" && (JobStatus == 2) && (CurrentTime - EnteredCurrentStatus > 3600) && ((RemoteSysCpu + RemoteUserCpu) < 61)) || (JobStatus == 1 && CumulativeSlotTime > 0) || (JobStatus == 5)' evaluated to TRUE
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) WriteUserLog Failed to convert event type # 9 to classAd.
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) WriteUserLog: user doWriteEvent()!
06/08/12 10:35:53 (pid:542544) Unable to log ULOG_JOB_ABORTED event for job 1727623.0

I'm on vacation right now, so may not be able to provide follow-ups.

2012-Jun-08 11:45:15 by bbockelm:
Got it!

In src/condor_utils/condor_event.cpp, we have this line: 

buf2.sprintf("Reason = \"%s\"", reason);
if( !myad->Insert(buf2.Value()) ) return NULL;

If the SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE macro has a double-quote, the value inserted into the classad is not properly escaped and fails.

So, this is OK: 

SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE = Foobar =?= True

but this is NOT OK: 

SYSTEM_PERIODIC_REMOVE = (Foobar =?= True) && (User =?= "bbockelm@unl.edu")

Isn't there a better API for inserting a string value into the classad?

There are a few other cases in this file where escaping is not properly done. In fact, I bet you could get the whole file to be about 1000 lines shorter and more reliable by using std::string and not raw char * handling.

Brian

2012-Jun-08 13:28:53 by jfrey:
There is a better API. ClassAd::Assign() should be used instead of ClassAd::Insert(). It's safer and should be faster. I'll fix up all the callsites in this file. The file won't get any shorter, though, because I also should add a pile of delete myad to eliminate memory leaks on error.

2012-Jun-12 14:42:21 by jfrey:
This bug affects other types of events as well. For any event type that contains a string datamember, an event will be dropped if that string contains a double-quote. This only affects logs written in XML, which uses the toClassAd() method.
